intro: Triumfetta acutiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
